title: Consolidates the village of Woodbury and town of Woodbury
summary: Consolidates the village of Woodbury and town of Woodbury to create the town of Woodbury, leaving the incorporated village of Harriman intact but prohibiting any new villages from being formed within the town limits.

       Introduced  by M. of A. CALHOUN -- read once and referred to the Commit-
         tee on Local Governments

       AN ACT to amend the general municipal law, in relation to  consolidating
         the village of Woodbury with the town of Woodbury

         THE  PEOPLE OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK, REPRESENTED IN SENATE AND ASSEM-
       BLY, DO ENACT AS FOLLOWS:

    1    Section 1. Legislative intent. It was and is the  intent  of  the  New
    2  N.Y.    Government Reorganization and Citizen Empowerment Act to provide
    3  opportunities for local governments and electors to  adopt  consolidated
    4  forms  of  local  governments, and this act provides that opportunity to
    5  the village and town of Woodbury upon certain terms.
    6    S 2. Sections 792 and 793 of the general municipal law are  renumbered
    7  sections 793 and 794 and a new section 792 is added to read as follows:
    8    S  792. CONSOLIDATION OF THE VILLAGE OF WOODBURY AND THE TOWN OF WOOD-
    9  BURY.  NOTWITHSTANDING ANY OTHER PROVISION OF THIS ARTICLE,  OR  ARTICLE
   10  TWO  OF THE VILLAGE LAW, THE VILLAGE AND TOWN OF WOODBURY, NEW YORK, MAY
   11  FORM A CONSOLIDATED LOCAL GOVERNMENT ENTITY  BY  A  JOINT  CONSOLIDATION
   12  AGREEMENT IN ACCORDANCE WITH THE PROVISIONS OF THIS ARTICLE, EXCEPT THAT
   13  THE  NEW GOVERNMENTAL ENTITY TO SURVIVE SHALL BE THE TOWN (INCLUDING THE
   14  EXISTING PORTION OF THE INCORPORATED VILLAGE OF HARRIMAN PRESENTLY WITH-
   15  IN THE BOUNDARIES OF THE TOWN OF WOODBURY) THAT SHALL HAVE  ALL  OF  THE
   16  POWERS,  DUTIES  AND OBLIGATIONS OF A GOVERNMENTAL ENTITY UNDER THE TOWN
   17  LAW, BUT SHALL NOT BE ELIGIBLE  FOR  THE  FORMATION  OF  ANY  ADDITIONAL
   18  VILLAGES WITHIN ITS LIMITS. THE NEW GOVERNMENTAL ENTITY TO SURVIVE SHALL
   19  BE  GOVERNED  INITIALLY BY THE THEN-EXISTING TOWN OF WOODBURY SUPERVISOR
   20  AND THE TOWN OF WOODBURY TOWN BOARD MEMBERS.
   21    S 3. Savings clause. If  any  portion,  clause,  sentence,  paragraph,
   22  section,  word,  or  part  of this act shall be adjudged by any court of
   23  competent jurisdiction to be invalid, such judgment  shall  not  affect,
   24  impair  or invalidate the remainder thereof but shall be confined in its
   25  operation to the portion, clause, sentence, paragraph, word, section  or
